description:
S73 application (Minor material amendment) to vary the wording of condition conditional no. 2 (DRAWINGS AND DOCUMENT NUMBERS) and 5 (WINDOWS OBSCURED AND FIXED SHUT) of planning permission P2023/3177/FUL, dated 26 March 2024. The application seeks the following amendments:
A] Proposed rear and side elevation window materials changed from timber to aluminium.
B] Wording of condition 5 changed as follows:
WINDOWS OBSCURED AND FIXED SHUT:  Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved windows shown as being obscurely glazed and identified on plans 930.204 rev. e and 930.209 rev e shall be provided as such prior to the first occupation of the development.  This includes
•	additional window at rear first floor level that serve Bedroom 1 to the rear elevation to be obscurely glazed to a height of 1.7m with an openable top panel
•	the window with the label 'enlarge window' at first floor level that serves Bedroom 3 to be obscurely glazed and fixed shut
All obscurely glazed windows shall be permanently maintained as such and shall be fixed shut, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
REASON: To prevent the undue overlooking of neighbouring habitable room windows.
decision_conditions:
S73 - CONSENT LIMITED TO THAT OF ORIGINAL PERMISSION:  The development hereby permitted shall be begun not later than the expiration of 26 Mar 2027

REASON: To ensure the commencement timescale for the development is not extended beyond that of the original planning permission granted on 26 Mar 2024  [LBI ref: [P2024/3177/FUL].    Furthermore, to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1)(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended by the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Chapter 5).
